verses.text: Yet now hear , O Jacob my servant ; and Israel , whom I have chosen :

Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* that made thee, and formed thee from the womb , \add which\add* will help thee; Fear not, O Jacob , my servant ; and thou, Jesurun , whom I have chosen.
For I will pour water upon him that is thirsty , and floods upon the dry ground : I will pour my spirit upon thy seed , and my blessing upon thine offspring :
And they shall spring up \add as\add* among the grass , as willows by the water courses.

One shall say , I \add am\add* the 
d \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; and another shall call \add himself\add* by the name of Jacob ; and another shall subscribe \add with\add* his hand unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and surname \add himself\add* by the name of Israel.

Thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* the King of Israel , and his redeemer the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of hosts ; I \add am\add* the first , and I \add am\add* the last ; and beside me \add there is\add* no God.
And who, as I, shall call , and shall declare it, and set it in order for me, since I appointed the ancient people ? and the things that are coming , and shall come , let them shew unto them.

Fear ye not, neither be afraid : have not I told thee from that time , and have declared \add it\add*? ye \add are\add* even my witnesses. Is there a God beside me? yea, \add there is\add* no God ; I know not \add any\add*.\f + \fr 44.8 \ft God; I: Heb. rock, etc\f* \p

¶ They that make a graven image \add are\add* all of them vanity ; and their delectable things shall not profit ; and they \add are\add* their own witnesses ; they see not, nor know ; that they may be ashamed.\f + \fr 44.9 \ft delectable: Heb. desirable\f*
Who hath formed a god , or molten a graven image \add that\add* is profitable for nothing ?

Behold, all his fellows shall be ashamed : and the workmen , they \add are\add* of men : let them all be gathered together , let them stand up ; \add yet\add* they shall fear , \add and\add* they shall be ashamed together.

The smith with the tongs both worketh in the coals , and fashioneth it with hammers , and worketh it with the strength of his arms : yea, he is hungry , and his strength faileth : he drinketh no water , and is faint.\f + \fr 44.12 \ft with the tongs: or, with an axe\f*

The carpenter stretcheth out \add his\add* rule ; he marketh it out with a line ; he fitteth it with planes , and he marketh it out with the compass , and maketh it after the figure of a man , according to the beauty of a man ; that it may remain in the house.

He heweth him down cedars , and taketh the cypress and the oak , which he strengtheneth for himself among the trees of the forest : he planteth an ash , and the rain doth nourish \add it\add*.\f + \fr 44.14 \ft strengtheneth: or, taketh courage\f*

Then shall it be for a man to burn : for he will take thereof, and warm himself; yea, he kindleth \add it\add*, and baketh bread ; yea, he maketh a god , and worshippeth \add it;\add* he maketh it a graven image , and falleth down thereto.

He burneth part thereof in the fire ; with part thereof he eateth flesh ; he roasteth roast , and is satisfied : yea, he warmeth \add himself\add*, and saith , Aha , I am warm , I have seen the fire :

And the residue thereof he maketh a god , \add even\add* his graven image : he falleth down unto it, and worshippeth \add it\add*, and prayeth unto it, and saith , Deliver me; for thou \add art\add* my god.
They have not known nor understood : for he hath shut their eyes , that they cannot see ; \add and\add* their hearts , that they cannot understand.\f + \fr 44.18 \ft shut: Heb. daubed\f*

And none considereth in his heart , neither \add is there\add* knowledge nor understanding to say , I have burned part of it in the fire ; yea, also I have baked bread upon the coals thereof; I have roasted flesh , and eaten \add it:\add* and shall I make the residue thereof an abomination ? shall I fall down to the stock of a tree ?\f + \fr 44.19 \ft considereth…: Heb. setteth to his heart\f*\f + \fr 44.19 \ft the stock…: Heb. that which comes of a tree?\f*
He feedeth on ashes : a deceived heart hath turned him aside , that he cannot deliver his soul , nor say , \add Is there\add* not a lie in my right hand ? \p
¶ Remember these, O Jacob and Israel ; for thou \add art\add* my servant : I have formed thee; thou \add art\add* my servant : O Israel , thou shalt not be forgotten of me.
I have blotted out , as a thick cloud , thy transgressions , and, as a cloud , thy sins : return unto me; for I have redeemed thee.

Sing , O ye heavens ; for the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath done \add it:\add* shout , ye lower parts of the earth : break forth into singing , ye mountains , O forest , and every tree therein: for the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath redeemed Jacob , and glorified himself in Israel.

Thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, thy redeemer , and he that formed thee from the womb , I \add am\add* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* that maketh all \add things;\add* that stretcheth forth the heavens alone; that spreadeth abroad the earth by myself;
That frustrateth the tokens of the liars , and maketh diviners mad ; that turneth wise \add men\add* backward , and maketh their knowledge foolish ;

That confirmeth the word of his servant , and performeth the counsel of his messengers ; that saith to Jerusalem , Thou shalt be inhabited ; and to the cities of Judah , Ye shall be built , and I will raise up the decayed places thereof:\f + \fr 44.26 \ft decayed…: Heb. wastes\f*
That saith to the deep , Be dry , and I will dry up thy rivers :
That saith of Cyrus , \add He is\add* my shepherd , and shall perform all my pleasure : even saying to Jerusalem , Thou shalt be built ; and to the temple , Thy foundation shall be laid.
